a.g: Alif, Lam, Meem, Ra. These are the verses of the Book; and what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth, but most of the people do not believe.

It is Allah who erected the heavens without pillars that you [can] see; then He established Himself above the Throne and made subject the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term. He arranges [each] matter; He details the signs that you may, of the meeting with your Lord, be certain.

And it is He who spread the earth and placed therein firmly set mountains and rivers; and from all of the fruits He made therein two mates; He causes the night to cover the day. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.

And within the land are neighboring plots and gardens of grapevines and crops and palm trees, [growing] several from a root or otherwise, watered with one water; but We make some of them exceed others in [quality of] fruit. Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason.

And if you are astonished, [O Muhammad] - then astonishing is their saying, "When we are dust, will we indeed be [brought] into a new creation?" Those are the ones who have disbelieved in their Lord, and those will have shackles upon their necks, and those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.

They impatiently urge you to bring about evil before good, while there has already occurred before them similar punishments [to what they demand]. And indeed, your Lord is full of forgiveness for the people despite their wrongdoing, and indeed, your Lord is severe in penalty.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال عز وجل: ﴿ وإن ربك لذو مغفرة للناس على ظلمهم ﴾ {} ويقال: (إن النبي ﭬ لم يزل يسأل في أمته حتى قيل له أما ترضى وقد أنزلت عليك هذه الآية: ﴿ وإن ربك لذو مغفرة للناس على ظلمهم ﴾ {}[13])
Indeed, your Lord is the Possessor of Forgiveness [maghfirah] for the people, despite their wrongdoing [zulm]. And it is said: Indeed, the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, did not cease to intercede for his community until it was said to him: "Are you not satisfied, when this verse has been revealed to you: 'Indeed, your Lord is the Possessor of Forgiveness [maghfirah] for the people, despite their wrongdoing [zulm]'?"

a.g: And those who disbelieved say, "Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?" You are only a warner, and for every people is a guide.
Allah knows what every female carries and what the wombs lose [prematurely] or exceed. And everything with Him is by due measure.
[He is] Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Grand, the Exalted.
It is the same [to Him] concerning you whether one conceals [his] speech or one publicizes it and whether one is hidden by night or conspicuous [among others] by day.

For each one are successive [angels] before and behind him who protect him by the decree of Allah. Indeed, Allah will not change the condition of a people until they change what is in themselves. And when Allah intends for a people ill, there is no repelling it. And there is not for them besides Him any patron.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وأما الفعل الدال على كونه محبوباً فهو أن يتولى الله تعالى أمره ظاهره وباطنه سره وجهره فيكون هو المشير عليه والمدبر لأمره والمزين لأخلاقه والمستعمل لجوارحه والمسدد لظاهره وباطنه والجاعل همومه هماً واحداً والمبغض للدنيا في قلبه والموحش له من غيره والمؤنس له بلذة المناجاة في خلواته والكاشف له عن الحجب بينه وبين معرفته. فهذا وأمثاله هو علامة حب الله للعبد. فلنذكر الآن علامة محبة العبد لله تعالى فإنها أيضاً من علامات حب الله تعالى للعبد. القول في علامات محبة العبد لله تعالى اعلم أن المحبة يدعيها كل أحد وما أسهل الدعوى وما أعز المعنى، فلا ينبغي أن يغتر الإنسان بتلبيس الشيطان وخدع النفس مهما ادعيت محبة الله تعالى ما لم يمتحنها بالعلامات ولم يطالبها بالبراهين والأدلة. والمحبة شجرة طيبة أصلها ثابت وفرعها في السماء وثمارها تظهر في القلب واللسان والجوارح. وتدل تلك الآثار الفائضة منها على القلب والجوارح على المحبة دلالة الدخان على النار ودلالة الثمار على الأشجار. وهي كثيرة فمنها حب لقاء الحبيب بطريق الكشف والمشاهدة في دار السلام، فلا يتصور أن يحب القلب محبوباً إلا ويحب مشاهدته ولقاءه، وإذا علم أنه لا وصول إلا بالارتحال من الدنيا ومفارقتها بالموت فينبغي أن يكون محباً للموت غير فار منه، فإن المحب لا يثقل عليه السفر عن وطنه إلى مستقر محبوبه ليتنعم بمشاهدته والموت مفتاح اللقاء وباب الدخول إلى المشاهدة. قال ﭬ: " من أحب لقاء الله أحب الله لقاءه". وقد شرط الله سبحانه لحقيقته الصدق في الحب القتل في سبيل الله، حيث قالوا إنا نحب الله فجعل القتل في سبيل الله وطلب
And as for the action indicating that he is beloved, it is that God, Exalted is He, takes charge of his affair—his outward and his inward, his secret and his public—so that He becomes the One who counsels him, manages his affair, adorns his character, employs his limbs, guides his outward and his inward, makes his concerns a single concern, makes him hate the world [dunya] in his heart [qalb], makes him feel desolate from other than Him, and makes him find intimacy in the delight of intimate discourse in his seclusions, and lifts for him the veils [hujub] between him and the knowledge [ma'rifa] of Him. This and its like is the sign of God's love for the servant. So let us now mention the sign of the servant's love for God, Exalted is He, for it is also among the signs of God's love for the servant. The discourse on the signs of the servant's love for God, Exalted is He: Know that love [mahabba] is claimed by everyone, and how easy is the claim, and how precious is the meaning. So let not a person be deceived by the delusion of Satan and the deceptions of the soul, however much he may claim love for God, Exalted is He, unless it is tested by the signs and demanded by the proofs and evidences. And love [mahabba] is a goodly tree; its root is firm and its branch is in the sky, and its fruits appear in the heart [qalb], the tongue, and the limbs. And those effects overflowing from it onto the heart [qalb] and the limbs indicate the love [mahabba] like the indication of smoke to fire and the indication of fruit to trees. And they are many. Among them is the love of meeting the Beloved through the path of unveiling [kashf] and witnessing [mushahada] in the Abode of Peace. For it is inconceivable that the heart [qalb] loves a beloved except that it loves to see him and meet him. And when he knows that there is no arrival except by departing from the world [dunya] and leaving it through death, then he must be a lover of death, not fleeing from it. For the lover is not burdened by the journey from his homeland to the abode of his beloved, to delight in seeing him. And death is the key to the meeting and the door of entry to the witnessing [mushahada]. He, peace be upon him, said: "Whoever loves to meet God, God loves to meet him." And God, glorified is He, has stipulated for the truthfulness of his love being killed in the path of God, when they said, "Indeed, we love God," so He made being killed in the path of God and seeking...

a.g: It is He who shows you lightening, [causing] fear and aspiration, and generates the heavy clouds.

And the thunder exalts [Allah] with praise of Him - and the angels [as well] from fear of Him - and He sends thunderbolts and strikes therewith whom He wills while they dispute about Allah; and He is severe in assault.

To Him [alone] is the supplication of truth. And those they call upon besides Him do not respond to them with a thing, except as one who stretches his hands toward water [from afar, calling it] to reach his mouth, but it will not reach it [thus]. And the supplication of the disbelievers is not but in error [i.e. futility].
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ولأبي بكر بن الضحاك في الشمائل من حديث ابن مسعود في إجابة المؤذن اللهم رب هذه الدعوة المجابة المستجاب لها دعوة الحق وكلمة الإخلاص ولابن عدي من حديث ابن عمر في إجابة المؤذن دعوة الحق وللطبراني في الدعاء عن عبد الله بن عمرو كلمة الإخلاص لا إله إلا الله الحديث وللطبراني من حديث سلمة بن الأكوع وألزمهم كلمة التقوى قال لا إله إلا الله وللطبراني في الدعاء عن ابن عباس كلمة طيبة قال شهادة أن لا إله إلا الله وله عنه في قوله دعوة الحق قال شهادة أن لا إله إلا الله وله عنه فقد استمسك بالعروة الوثقى قال لا إله الا الله ولابن عدى والمستغفري من حديث أنس ثمن الجنة لا اله إلا الله ولا يصح شيء منها.
And for Abu Bakr ibn al-Dahhak in *Al-Shama'il*, from the hadith of Ibn Mas'ud regarding responding to the caller to prayer: "O Allah, Lord of this answered call [ad-da'wah al-mujabah], the call that is responded to [al-mustajab laha], the call of truth [da'wat al-haqq] and the word of sincerity [kalimat al-ikhlas]." And for Ibn 'Adi, from the hadith of Ibn 'Umar regarding responding to the caller to prayer: "The call of truth [da'wat al-haqq]." And for Al-Tabarani in *Al-Du'a*, from 'Abdullah ibn 'Amr: "The word of sincerity [kalimat al-ikhlas]: 'There is no god but Allah'—the hadith." And for Al-Tabarani from the hadith of Salamah ibn al-Akwa': "And He has made binding upon them the word of God-consciousness [kalimat al-taqwa]." He said: "'There is no god but Allah'." And for Al-Tabarani in *Al-Du'a*, from Ibn 'Abbas: "A goodly word [kalimah tayyibah]." He said: "The testimony that there is no god but Allah." And from him, regarding His saying: "The call of truth [da'wat al-haqq]." He said: "The testimony that there is no god but Allah." And from him: "He has grasped the most trustworthy handhold [al-'urwah al-wuthqa]." He said: "'There is no god but Allah'." And for Ibn 'Adi and Al-Mustaghfiri, from the hadith of Anas: "The price of Paradise is 'There is no god but Allah'." And none of these are sound.

a.g: And to Allah prostrates whoever is within the heavens and the earth, willingly or by compulsion, and their shadows [as well] in the mornings and the afternoons.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
إن العبد المؤمن يدرك أن ساعات النهار والليل موزعة أوراداً للذكر والعبادة، ومنها الورد الخامس الذي يمتد من بعد الظهر إلى العصر، وهو وقت غفلة الناس، فينبغي للعاقل أن يحييه بالصلاة والذكر انتظاراً للصلاة، اقتداءً بسنة السلف. وهذا الورد هو أحد الغدو والآصال التي ذكرها الله تعالى إذ قال: ﴿ ولله يسجد من في السموات والأرض طوعا وكرها وظلالهم بالغدو والآصال ﴾. فإذا سجدت الجمادات لله عز وجل طوعاً وكرهاً في هذه الأوقات، فكيف يجوز للعبد العاقل أن يغفل عن أنواع العبادات في مثل هذه الساعات الشريفة، بل يجب عليه أن يشاركها في السجود الاختياري طوعاً، ليكون من الساجدين المحبوبين.
Indeed, the believing servant [al-'abd al-mu'min] perceives that the hours of day and night are apportioned as litanies [awrad] for remembrance [dhikr] and worship ['ibadah], and among them is the fifth litany [al-ward al-khamis] which extends from after the noon [al-zuhr] prayer until the afternoon [al-'asr] prayer, and it is a time of people's heedlessness [ghaflah]. Therefore, it is incumbent upon the discerning one [al-'aqil] to revive it with prayer [salah] and remembrance [dhikr] in anticipation of the prayer, following the tradition [sunnah] of the predecessors [al-salaf]. And this litany [al-ward] is one of the mornings and evenings [al-ghuduww wa al-asal] which God, the Exalted, mentioned when He said: "And to God prostrates whoever is in the heavens and the earth, willingly or unwillingly, and their shadows as well, in the mornings and the evenings [bil-ghuduwwi wal-asal]." So if inanimate things prostrate to God, the Mighty and Majestic, willingly or unwillingly, in these times, then how can it be permissible for the discerning servant [al-'abd al-'aqil] to be heedless [yaghfil] of the varieties of worship ['ibadat] in such noble hours? Rather, it is obligatory upon him to join them in the voluntary prostration [al-sujud al-ikhtiyari] willingly, so that he may be among the beloved prostrators [al-sajidin al-mahbubin].

a.g: Say, "Who is Lord of the heavens and earth?" Say, "Allah." Say, "Have you then taken besides Him allies not possessing [even] for themselves any benefit or any harm?" Say, "Is the blind equivalent to the seeing? Or is darkness equivalent to light? Or have they attributed to Allah partners who created like His creation so that the creation [of each] seemed similar to them?" Say, "Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is the One, the Prevailing."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
الأصل الأول: العلم بأن كل حادث في العالم فهو فعله وخلقه واختراعه لا خالق له سواه ولا محدث له إلا إياه خلق الخلق وصنعهم وأوجد قدرتهم وحركتهم فجميع أفعال عباده مخلوقة له ومتعلقة بقدرته تصديقا له في قوله تعالى الله خالق كل شيء.
Indeed, the First Principle: Knowledge [ma'rifa] that every originated thing [hadith] in the world [al-'alam] is His act [fi'l] and His creation [khalq] and His invention [ikhtira'], there is no creator [khalq] for it other than Him, and no originator [muhdith] for it except Him. He created the creation [khalq] and fashioned them, and brought their power [qudra] and their movement [haraka] into existence. Thus, all the actions [af'al] of His servants are created [makhluqa] by Him and connected to His power [qudra], in confirmation of Him in His Exalted saying: "Allah is the Creator [Khaliq] of all things."

a.g: He sends down from the sky, rain, and valleys flow according to their capacity, and the torrent carries a rising foam. And from that [ore] which they heat in the fire, desiring adornments and utensils, is a foam like it. Thus Allah presents [the example of] truth and falsehood. As for the foam, it vanishes, [being] cast off; but as for that which benefits the people, it remains on the earth. Thus does Allah present examples.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وأما المدرك بالشرع فهو أن يكون إجراؤه على الظاهر ممكنا ولكنه يروى أنه أريد به غير الظاهر كما ورد في تفسير قوله تعالى: ﴿ أنزل من السماء ماء فسالت أودية بقدرها ﴾ {} الآية وأن معنى الماء ههنا هو القرآن ومعنى الأودية هي القلوب وأن بعضها احتملت شيئا كثيرا وبعضها قليلا وبعضها لم يحتمل والزبد مثل الكفر والنفاق فإنه وإن ظهر وطفا على رأس الماء فإنه لا يثبت والهداية التي تنفع الناس تمكث.
Indeed, the perception [idrak] by the Sacred Law [shar'] is that its application according to the outward [zahir] meaning is possible, but it is narrated that something other than the outward [zahir] is intended by it, as has come in the interpretation of His, the Exalted's, saying: "He sends down from the sky water, and the valleys flow according to their measure..." and that the meaning of the water [ma'] here is the Qur'an, and the meaning of the valleys [awdiyah] are the hearts [qulub], and that some of them bear a great deal, and some a little, and some bear nothing. And the scum [zabad] is like disbelief [kufr] and hypocrisy [nifaq], for even if it appears and floats atop the water, it does not endure, and the guidance [hidayah] which benefits the people remains.

a.g: For those who have responded to their Lord is the best [reward], but those who did not respond to Him - if they had all that is in the earth entirely and the like of it with it, they would [attempt to] ransom themselves thereby. Those will have the worst account, and their refuge is Hell, and wretched is the resting place.
Then is he who knows that what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth like one who is blind? They will only be reminded who are people of understanding -
Those who fulfill the covenant of Allah and do not break the contract,
And those who join that which Allah has ordered to be joined and fear their Lord and are afraid of the evil of [their] account,

And those who are patient, seeking the countenance of their Lord, and establish prayer and spend from what We have provided for them secretly and publicly and prevent evil with good - those will have the good consequence of [this] home -

Gardens of perpetual residence; they will enter them with whoever were righteous among their fathers, their spouses and their descendants. And the angels will enter upon them from every gate, [saying],
"Peace be upon you for what you patiently endured. And excellent is the final home."

But those who break the covenant of Allah after contracting it and sever that which Allah has ordered to be joined and spread corruption on earth - for them is the curse, and they will have the worst home.
Allah extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]. And they rejoice in the worldly life, while the worldly life is not, compared to the Hereafter, except [brief] enjoyment.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى "وما الحياة الدنيا في الآخرة إلا متاع" وذلك الفرح بالدنيا سم قاتل يسري في العروق فيخرج من القلب الخوف والحزن وذكر الموت وأهوال يوم القيامة، وهذا هو موت القلب. قال الله تعالى "ورضوا بالحياة الدنيا واطمأنوابها" وقال تعالى "وما الحياة الدنيا في الآخرة إلا متاع" وقال تعالى "اعلموا إنما الحياة الدنيا لعب ولهو وزينة وتفاخر بينكم وتكاثر في الأموال والأولاد" وكل ذلك ذم لها فنسأل الله السلامة.
Indeed, God the Exalted has said, "And what is the life of this world [al-dunya] in the Hereafter [al-akhirah] except a brief enjoyment." And that rejoicing in the world [al-dunya] is a lethal poison that courses through the veins, and it expels from the heart [qalb] fear and sorrow and the remembrance of death and the terrors of the Day of Resurrection, and this is the death of the heart [qalb]. God the Exalted has said, "And they were content with the life of this world [al-dunya] and felt secure in it." And He the Exalted has said, "And what is the life of this world [al-dunya] in the Hereafter [al-akhirah] except a brief enjoyment." And He the Exalted has said, "Know that the life of this world [al-dunya] is but play and amusement, adornment and mutual boasting, and rivalry in wealth and children." And all of that is a censure of it, so we ask God for safety.

a.g: And those who disbelieved say, "Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?" Say, [O Muhammad], "Indeed, Allah leaves astray whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever turns back [to Him] -
Those who have believed and whose hearts are assured by the remembrance of Allah. Unquestionably, by the remembrance of Allah hearts are assured."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وعلامة المحبة كمال الأنس بمناجاة المحبوب وكمال التنعم بالخلوة به وكمال الاستيحاش من كل ما ينغص عليه الخلوة ويعوق عن لذة المناجاة. وعلامة الأنس مصير العقل والفهم كله مستغرقاً بلذة المناجاة، كالذي يخاطب معشوقه ويناجيه، وقد انتهت هذه اللذة ببعضهم حتى كان في صلاته ووقع الحريق في داره فلم يشعر به، وقطعت رجل بعضهم بسبب علة أصابته وهو في الصلاة فلم يشعر به ومهما غلب الحب والأنس صارت الخلوة والمناجاة قرة عينه يدفع بها جميع الهموم، بل يستغرق الأنس والحب قلبه حتى لا يفهم أمور الدنيا ما لم تكرر على سمعه مراراً. مثل العاشق الولهان فإنه يكلم الناس بلسانه وأنسه في الباطن بذكر حبيبه. فالمحب من لا يطمئن إلا بمحبوبه. وقال قتادة في قوله تعالى: " الذين آمنوا وتطمئن قلوبهم بذكر الله ألا بذكر الله تطمئن القلوب" قال: هشت إليه واستأنست به.
Indeed, the sign of love [mahabba] is the perfection of intimacy [uns] in the private discourse with the Beloved, and the perfection of delight [tan'um] in seclusion [khalwa] with Him, and the perfection of aversion [istihash] from all that spoils this seclusion and obstructs the pleasure of intimate discourse. And the sign of intimacy [uns] is the state where the intellect ['aql] and understanding [fahm] become entirely absorbed in the pleasure of intimate discourse, like one who addresses and converses privately with his beloved. This pleasure reached such a degree with some that a fire broke out in his house while he was in prayer and he did not perceive it, and the leg of another was amputated due to an affliction that befell him while he was in prayer and he did not perceive it. Whenever love [hubb] and intimacy [uns] prevail, seclusion [khalwa] and intimate discourse [munajah] become the coolness of his eye, repelling all worries. Rather, the intimacy [uns] and love [hubb] so absorb his heart [qalb] that he does not comprehend the affairs of the world [dunya] unless they are repeated to his hearing many times. Like the infatuated, passionate lover who speaks to people with his tongue while his inner being [batin] is intimate with the remembrance [dhikr] of his beloved. Thus, the lover [muhibb] is he who finds no tranquility [tuma'nina] except with his Beloved. And Qatadah said concerning His, the Exalted's, statement: "Those who have believed and whose hearts [qulub] find tranquility [tatma'innu] in the remembrance [dhikr] of Allah. Unquestionably, by the remembrance [dhikr] of Allah do hearts [qulub] find tranquility [tatma'innu]": He said: It inclined to Him and found intimacy [istanasat] with Him.

a.g: Those who have believed and done righteous deeds - a good state is theirs and a good return.

Thus have We sent you to a community before which [other] communities have passed on so you might recite to them that which We revealed to you, while they disbelieve in the Most Merciful. Say, "He is my Lord; there is no deity except Him. Upon Him I rely, and to Him is my return."

And if there was any qur'an by which the mountains would be removed or the earth would be broken apart or the dead would be made to speak, [it would be this Qur'an], but to Allah belongs the affair entirely. Then have those who believed not accepted that had Allah willed, He would have guided the people, all of them? And those who disbelieve do not cease to be struck, for what they have done, by calamity - or it will descend near their home - until there comes the promise of Allah. Indeed, Allah does not fail in [His] promise.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقول الله عز وجل أن لو يشاء الله لهدى الناس جميعا ويدل عليه من جهة العقل أن المعاصي والجرائم إن كان الله يكرهها ولا يريدها وإنما هي جارية على وفق إرادة العدو إبليس لعنه الله مع أنه عدو لله سبحانه والجاري على وفق إرادة العدو أكثر من الجاري على وفق إرادته تعالى فليت شعري كيف يستجيز المسلم أن يرد ملك الجبار ذي الجلال والإكرام إلى رتبة لو ردت إليها رياسة زعيم ضيعة لاستنكف منها إذ لو كان ما يستمر لعدو الزعيم في القرية أكثر مما يستقيم له لاستنكف من زعامته وتبرأ عن ولايته والمعصية هي الغالبة على الخلق وكل ذلك جار عند المبتدعة على خلاف إرادة الحق تعالى وهذا غاية الضعف والعجز تعالى رب الأرباب عن قول الظالمين علوا كبيرا ثم مهما ظهر أن أفعال العباد مخلوقة لله صح أنها مرادة له.
Indeed, if Allah [God] willed, He would have guided all people [al-nas] collectively. And what indicates this from the perspective of reason [al-'aql] is that sins [al-ma'asi] and crimes—if Allah detests them and does not will them, and they only occur in accordance with the will of the enemy, Iblis [the Devil], may Allah curse him, even though he is an enemy to Allah, the Glorified—and what occurs in accordance with the will of the enemy is more than what occurs in accordance with His will, the Exalted... Then, I wonder how a Muslim can permit himself to reduce the dominion of the Compeller [al-Jabbar], Possessor of Majesty and Honor, to a rank that, if the leadership of a village chief were reduced to it, he would disdain it. For if what continues for the enemy of the chief in the village is more than what is set right for him, he would disdain his leadership and absolve himself of his authority. And disobedience [al-ma'siyah] is what predominates over creation [al-khalq], and all of that, according to the innovators [al-mubtadi'ah], occurs contrary to the will of the Truth [al-Haqq], the Exalted. And this is the ultimate weakness and incapacity—exalted is the Lord of all lords [Rabb al-arbab] far above what the wrongdoers say, supremely great. Then, whenever it becomes clear that the actions of the servants [al-'ibad] are created by Allah, it is correct that they are willed by Him.

a.g: And already were [other] messengers ridiculed before you, and I extended the time of those who disbelieved; then I seized them, and how [terrible] was My penalty.

Then is He who is a maintainer of every soul, [knowing] what it has earned, [like any other]? But to Allah they have attributed partners. Say, "Name them. Or do you inform Him of that which He knows not upon the earth or of what is apparent of speech?" Rather, their [own] plan has been made attractive to those who disbelieve, and they have been averted from the way. And whomever Allah leaves astray - there will be for him no guide.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
الحمد لله القائم على كل نفس بما كسبت الرقيب على كل جارحة بما اجترحت المطلع على ضمائر القلوب إذا هجست الحسيب على خواطر عباده إذا اختلجت الذى لا يعزب عن علمه مثقال ذرة في السموات والأرض تحركت أو سكنت المحاسب على النقير والقطمير والقليل والكثير من الأعمال وإن خفيت المتفضل بقبول طاعات العباد وان صغرت المتطول بالعفو عن من معاصيهم وإن كثرت وإنما يحاسبهم لتعلم كل نفس ما أحضرت وتنظر فيما قدمت وأخرت فتعلم انه لولا لزومها للمراقبة والمحاسبة في الدنيا لشفيت في صعيد القيامة وهلكت وقد قال تعالى أفمن هو قائم على كل نفس بما كسبت
Praise be to God [Allah], the One Who is Established [al-Qa'im] over every soul [nafs] with what it has earned, the Watchful [al-Raqib] over every limb with what it has perpetrated, the One Aware [al-Muttali'] of the secret thoughts [dama'ir] of the hearts [qulub] when they whisper, the Reckoner [al-Hasib] over the fleeting thoughts [khawatir] of His servants when they stir. He from Whose knowledge ['ilm] not an atom's weight in the heavens or the earth escapes, whether it moves or is still. The One Who takes account [al-Muhasib] of the speck [al-naqir] and the seed-skin [al-qitmir], the little and the much of deeds, even if they are hidden. The Bestower of Favor [al-Mutafaddil] by accepting the acts of obedience [ta'at] of His servants even if they are small. The Vastly Forbearing [al-Mutawalli] by pardoning their sins [ma'asi] even if they are many. And He only calls them to account so that every soul [nafs] may know what it has brought forth, and look upon what it has sent ahead and left behind, so that it may know that had it not adhered to vigilance [muraqaba] and self-reckoning [muhasaba] in this world [al-dunya], it would have been laid bare on the plain of the Resurrection [al-Qiyamah] and perished. And He, the Exalted, has said: "Is He then Who is Established [al-Qa'im] over every soul [nafs] with what it has earned...?"

a.g: For them will be punishment in the life of [this] world, and the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe. And they will not have from Allah any protector.

The example of Paradise, which the righteous have been promised, is [that] beneath it rivers flow. Its fruit is lasting, and its shade. That is the consequence for the righteous, and the consequence for the disbelievers is the Fire.

And [the believers among] those to whom We have given the [previous] Scripture rejoice at what has been revealed to you, [O Muhammad], but among the [opposing] factions are those who deny part of it. Say, "I have only been commanded to worship Allah and not associate [anything] with Him. To Him I invite, and to Him is my return."
And thus We have revealed it as an Arabic legislation. And if you should follow their inclinations after what has come to you of knowledge, you would not have against Allah any ally or any protector.

And We have already sent messengers before you and assigned to them wives and descendants. And it was not for a messenger to come with a sign except by permission of Allah. For every term is a decree.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى في وصف الرسل ومدحهم (ولقد أرسلنا رسلا من قبلك وجعلنا لهم أزواجا وذرية) فذكر ذلك في معرض الامتنان وإظهار الفضل.
Indeed, the Most High has said in describing the Messengers and praising them: "And We have already sent messengers before you and appointed for them wives and offspring [dhurriyya]." He mentioned this in the context of bestowing favor [imtinan] and manifesting grace [fadl].

a.g: Allah eliminates what He wills or confirms, and with Him is the Mother of the Book.
And whether We show you part of what We promise them or take you in death, upon you is only the [duty of] notification, and upon Us is the account.
Have they not seen that We set upon the land, reducing it from its borders? And Allah decides; there is no adjuster of His decision. And He is swift in account.
And those before them had plotted, but to Allah belongs the plan entirely. He knows what every soul earns, and the disbelievers will know for whom is the final home.
And those who have disbelieved say, "You are not a messenger." Say, [O Muhammad], "Sufficient is Allah as Witness between me and you, and [the witness of] whoever has knowledge of the Scripture."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى: ﴿قل كفى بالله شهيدا بيني وبينكم ومن عنده علم الكتاب﴾
Say: "Sufficient is Allah as a Witness [shahīd] between me and you, and whoever possesses knowledge [‘ilm] of the Book [kitāb]."
